column5: Hi all, a good buddy of mine is on borrowed time so me and the boys are taking him on a road trip. He can't keep anything in his system for more than thirty mins so we figured renting an RV and parking it on the water was our best bet.  Right now he's back with his parents in the Hamilton area and we don't want to drive more than 3 hours in any direction to limit the discomfort of the drive. Any recommendations of a spot we can park close to the water would be much appreciated. Also I've found one or two places that rent RVs but is anyone knows where I can rent real big one that would be awesome.  Thanks  Steve
If I'm not mistaken there's a place just south of Bolton that rents the larger RV's, sorry can't think of the name.
Thanks bud I'll put google right on that.
Canadream.com for the RV rental... We see lots of them on the road.  As for location? Hard to beat the quinte region.  G

Bobowski ask a question the other day about Baycrest lodge; that caught my interest for an ice fishing weekend. Did some searching on the place and I think it might fit the bill for you? They claim too have camp sites to handle RV's.  http://www.quintefishing.com/baycrest/baycrest.htm  Have a look.  Dan.

I parked the RV at an campground in Stonecliffe  Full hook ups and had some sites that would fit my motorhome,  It is on the Ottawa River East of Mattawa.  However might be more than 3 hours  Good walleye and Bass fishing,  They rented boats
Here are some links to try  hamiltonrvrentals.com  stonypointresort.ca   on Rice Lake at Hasting.  You can shore fish there at the locks.  Regards
Thanks for all the help guys.  Much appreciated
